In the morning many cyclists and people walking. There are containers, please make use of them, we saw a lot of garbage on the walk we did .. a shame. From the E-5, send a chunk along a road with many potholes, take the detour and pass by the restaurant "Los nueva hornos de Ángel".

Gratuitous. large aldi supermarket and hiper-usera, next door. you can use their toilets without giving explanations. gas station, mc donald, bars, restaurants. and quiet nights, although you have to keep in mind that it is in the middle of a city. enjoy it

title: (28743) Canencia - 147 Calle Diseminado
title_short: (28743) Canencia - 147 Calle Diseminado

We spent the night there, advised by the Forest Agents after we got kicked out of the Pto Canencia recreational area due to "the covid" ... they told us that there we would have no problems staying overnight and that's how it was.

title: (28194) Robledillo de la Jara - M-127
title_short: (28194) Robledillo de la Jara -  M-127

title: (28410) Manzanares el Real -

title: (28754) - M-127
description: Perfect place to come to spend a quiet night. You can only pass with a 4x4 vehicle as the entrance is sloping, has fine sand and ruts. During the week there is no one, on the weekend you can meet 3 or 4 groups of hikers. The views are sooooo worth it!

title: (28194) Robledillo de la Jara - 35 Calle de la Fuente
title_short: (28194) Robledillo de la Jara - 35 Calle de la Fuente
description: At the exit of the town of Robledillo de la Jara. There is only a picnic area and space for two motorhomes. climbs to the ditch parallel to the road. In the morning at 9 there are already motorcycles and bikes circulating on the road. the good thing is that 2 minutes walk you have the town.

title: (28410) Manzanares el Real - 33 Avenida de la Pedriza
title_short: (28410) Manzanares el Real - 33 Avenida de la Pedriza

title: (28413) -

title_short: (28055) Madrid - 1 Avenida Hispanidad

title_short: (28492) Manzanares el Real - 6 Camino Canto Cochino

title: (28050) Madrid - 45 Calle de María Tudor

title_short: (28816) Camarma de Esteruelas - Vereda de Camarma al Puente de Zulema

The road is dirt, with some potholes but it is reached without problem. Without a doubt, the best place in Camarma and surroundings, including Alcalá de Henares.

name: Camping Monte Holiday
title: (28739) Camping Monte Holiday
title_short: (28739) Camping Monte Holiday
description: Beautiful campsite in the mountains for a good price. Loads of hiking nearby. Staff incredibly helpful.

title: (28055) Madrid - 8 Avenida de las Fuerzas Armadas
title_short: (28055) Madrid - 8 Avenida de las Fuerzas Armadas
description: Very large parking and in a quiet area. In front of Gasolinera and Burger. Next to the park and recreation area. Ground floor and illuminated all night.

title: (28050) Madrid - 11 Calle del Arroyo de Valdebebas
title_short: (28050) Madrid - 11 Calle del Arroyo de Valdebebas
description: Perfect place to sleep, a little noise from cars, but the truth is that very quiet, 50 meters from a bus stop, we were 3 days without problems of any kind, quite flat in some parking spaces.

title: (28050) Madrid - 2 Calle de Vicente Blasco Ibáñez
title_short: (28050) Madrid - 2 Calle de Vicente Blasco Ibáñez
description: Quiet street to spend the night. Slightly sloping and no service.

title: (28055) Madrid - Av. de las Fuerzas Armadas
title_short: (28055) Madrid - Av. de las Fuerzas Armadas
description: Parking very close to Ifema, perfect for the Mad Cool Festival (5 to 10 min walk from the entrance). A few trees create shade, and a large public park is a 2-minute walk away with very clean toilets open during the day (go to the second brown hut, the 1st is a technical room). There is something to walk around and games for children. Tap with drinking water. Despite the festival, we were only a few Vans and CCs on this huge parking lot, so all very well-off and spaced out. For light sleepers, bring earplugs for the return walk of festival-goers, but the road is closed to traffic so perfect for the night.

title: (28194) Berzosa del Lozoya -
title_short: (28194) Berzosa del Lozoya -
description: Parking next to the road on the outskirts of town, large motorhomes is still fair, if it catches you on the way you can spend the night

title: (28048) Madrid - 1D Calle Almenas
title_short: (28048) Madrid - 1D Calle Almenas
description: Close to the center, along a busy road, but there are currently several campers, parking is officially not allowed along the (quite quiet) road with a park next to it.

title: (28048) Madrid - 2A Carretera Colmenar Viejo
title_short: (28048) Madrid - 2A Carretera Colmenar Viejo
description: A large, flat, sandy parking area not far from the palace, dam and reservoir, with shade for cars but little for taller vehicles. The more than 40 picnic tables suggest that it gets crowded in the summer. Good for walking, including steps to the river. It can be windy, with little shelter. Clean and quiet. There is no lighting.

title: (28730) Buitrago del Lozoya - 14 Diseminado los Campillos
title_short: (28730) Buitrago del Lozoya - 14 Diseminado los Campillos
description: 5 minutes from the lake. Free ground parking. No service. Just calm. Forbidden to stay overnight.

title: (28034) Madrid - 10 Calle Condestables
title_short: (28034) Madrid - 10 Calle Condestables
description:
A free and fairly quiet car park both during the day and at night.

A 10 minute walk from a metro stop. And by bike 10 minutes from the Castellana.

Highly recommended for old or unlabeled campers, since they cannot enter the m30 and interior of Madrid, due to the environment.

There are no parking lots so close and free around the city.

The only drawback is that it has quite a few holes in the ground, be careful with the bass, although going slow is no problem.

title: (28749) Alameda del Valle -
title_short: (28749) Alameda del Valle -
description: Around a hermitage, there are cows during the day but at night it is super quiet to sleep. It's plain :)

title: (28042) Madrid - 45 Calle de la Playa de Riazor
title_short: (28042) Madrid - 45 Calle de la Playa de Riazor
description: A public bathroom and free parking next to the Barajas metro stop, very busy but perfect for not entering the city by car

address.street: 45 Calle de la Playa de Riazor

title: (28190) Puebla de la Sierra - M130
title_short: (28190) Puebla de la Sierra - M130
description: Very narrow road to get there. very quiet area to spend the day. walks in the mountains.

title: (28048) Madrid -
title_short: (28048) Madrid -
description: Pothole dirt parking. Area with tables spread around. Do not make fire. Several routes to enjoy hiking through Mount El Pardo.

title: (28048) Madrid - M-612
description: Small parking site with picknick table and a beautiful view. to have a relaxed day and enjoy nature or the tasteful restaurant at the other side of the road.

title: (28413) El Boalo - 9 Calle Cañada
title_short: (28413) El Boalo - 9 Calle Cañada
description: Nice views, nearby fountain and picnic tables, dumpsters, good place to run and bike, climb 30mins. Quiet place to sleep.

title: (28413) El Boalo - 2 Avenida de la Paz
title_short: (28413) El Boalo - 2 Avenida de la Paz
description: Parking in raised ground on a municipal ground. It is a quiet place to spend the night, even if it is in the village. It is very close to El Boalo access to La Pedriza. In a large park where there are sports fields, a fountain, etc. Area with very nice views and lots of shade. Wooded and sheltered. At City Hall, they told us it was ok if they are not long stays. The first week of July, apparently, there is a feria. Maybe there are more difficulties. We had two nights without problems, there was only one other van. Great for walking in the Sierra.

title: (28033) Madrid - 38 Calle Santa Adela
title_short: (28033) Madrid - 38 Calle Santa Adela
description: Very large parking. Metro 5 min walk. No parking problems, I have a motorhome and live in front. The only thing on Sundays you can not park by market. You can also park in front.

title: (28035) Madrid - 46 Avenida del Ventisquero de la Condesa
title_short: (28035) Madrid - 46 Avenida del Ventisquero de la Condesa
description: Free parking area, quite flat, during the busy day but very quiet nights and weekends, without services, but next to a gas station with all services. Valid to sleep peacefully one night.

address.street: 46 Avenida del Ventisquero de la Condesa

title: (28042) Madrid - 2 Calle Prov Parque Valdebebas 5
title_short: (28042) Madrid - 2 Calle Prov Parque Valdebebas 5
description: Ground parking. It has about 20 seats. next to where Real Madrid train and Valdebebas park

title: (28742) Lozoya - Calle del Arco de la Iglesia
title_short: (28742) Lozoya - Calle del Arco de la Iglesia
description: Recreation area near the river. There are places to park. Peaceful place.

address.street: Calle del Arco de la Iglesia

title: (28413) El Boalo - 18 Calle de la Peña Hoyuela
title_short: (28413) El Boalo - 18 Calle de la Peña Hoyuela
description: Parking in the center of the village 3 minutes from the plaza del ayuntamiento, very quiet for the night.

title: (28880) Meco - 414 Poligono Unidad 24
title_short: (28880) Meco - 414 Poligono Unidad 24
description: Free municipal parking in the town of Meco. flat, plenty of parking, and quiet at night. near the church.

title: (28739) - Calle Buitrago
title_short: (28739)  - Calle Buitrago
description: Natural places in the middle of the mountains 1km from the houses, nothing around except cows and a sublime view of the lake. Quiet night and day, we spent 2 nights there without problem except the cold given that we are there in December. Have a good trip and a good trip.

title: (28048) Madrid - Carr. Somontes al Palacio de la Real Quinta
title_short: (28048) Madrid - Carr. Somontes al Palacio de la Real Quinta
description: Land parking with roofed area and without roof. Some tables scattered around. Roads with routes. Nearby there is a restaurant. Possibility of visiting the Palacio de la Quinta.

address.street: Carr. Somontes al Palacio de la Real Quinta

title: (28413) El Boalo - 6 M-617
description: Great place to come and relax after visiting Madrid. All services clean and free, large parking area for motorhomes with views to the Sierras. Town has bakery, small supermarket and a couple of bars. New bollards with electrical supply but not commission yet.

title: (28042) Madrid - 22 Calle de Ayerbe
title_short: (28042) Madrid - 22 Calle de Ayerbe
description: Large free car park, very well lit. Metro 10 minutes, Place Sol 40 minutes. Terminal T2 20 mins walk. Close to Mc Donalds, Repsol, friendly staff, very helpful, professional and efficient. Many bars, restaurants, cafeterias and shops. Very quiet at night and quite busy in the morning. Flight and airport personnel park there. There is therefore constant movement and police rounds. *** no parking Friday evening-late Saturday evening it is market day ***

title: (28049) Madrid -
title_short: (28049) Madrid -
description: Together Suburban Station and Metro de Pitis. Ideal to go to the center (Puerta del Sol) of Madrid in 5 stations, in Cercanías (constant trains). also on line of Metro 7. With three bus stops: 49 to Pza de Castilla, 64 A Glorieta de Cuatro Caminos and 82, to Moncloa. You can spend the night in any of the many streets in the area or in the free parking of the station. Quiet zone. With quick exit to the M40. It is a great residential area. Good Bar Restaurant on the terrace of the station.

title: (28034) Madrid - 24 Calle Sangenjo
title_short: (28034) Madrid - 24 Calle Sangenjo
description: Laundry. It has washers of up to 15 / 18Kg and dryers. Banknote exchange machine for coins.

title: (28412) El Boalo - 579 Carretera de Colmenar Viejo
title_short: (28412) El Boalo - 579 Carretera de Colmenar Viejo
description: Picnic area at the entrance to the town of Cerceda coming from Madrid. There is a small flat area to leave the van and picnic tables and rubbish bins. It is attached to the road but does not have much traffic at night.

title: (28730) Buitrago del Lozoya - 22 Avenida de Madrid
title_short: (28730) Buitrago del Lozoya - 22 Avenida de Madrid
description: Repsol service station.

title: (28240) Hoyo de Manzanares - 11 Camino del Cementerio
title_short: (28240) Hoyo de Manzanares - 11 Camino del Cementerio
description: Parking for vans in a quiet place a bit out of town. Access open 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Access gate to the park "la cabilda". Drinking water source ten minutes walk inside the park. There are several sources inside; They are not signposted, but the path is wide enough to find them easily. Quiet and discreet place, little frequented except for summer weekends during the day.

title: (28730) Buitrago del Lozoya - 3 Camino del Cementerio
title_short: (28730) Buitrago del Lozoya - 3 Camino del Cementerio
description: Quiet area to spend the night or rest for a while. We met three more ACs and spent the night.

title: (28730) Buitrago del Lozoya - Avenue de Madrid
title_short: (28730) Buitrago del Lozoya - Avenue de Madrid
description: Good place to sleep and see the town in front of a Repsol and behind the Civil Guard barracks, it is a fairly quiet dirt parking lot

title: (28741) Rascafría - PK. 31 M-604
title_short: (28741) Rascafría - PK. 31 M-604
description: A spectacular enclave in nature. There is internet, garbage cans, and hiking trails.

title: (28742) Lozoya - Calle del Arco de la Iglesia
title_short: (28742) Lozoya - Calle del Arco de la Iglesia
description: Take the exit at Lozoya, direction Madrid. We pass in front of a firefighter installation "bomberos". We asked them if we could park and they said yes. Lake view, superb.

address.street: Calle del Arco de la Iglesia

title: (28046) Madrid - 300 Paseo de la Castellana
title_short: (28046) Madrid - 300 Paseo de la Castellana
description: Parking area green / blue free from 8pm and weekends. It is very close to the Chamartin metro and train station and the Plaza de Castilla bus and metro station. There is a market nearby, as well as bakeries, bars and other services. There are good views of the four towers but it is a bit noisy area being close to the Castellana.

title: (28861) Paracuellos de Jarama - 7 Calle de los Galgos
title_short: (28861) Paracuellos de Jarama - 7 Calle de los Galgos
description: Parking for long term departures (paid). Near the airport. Secured and safe. 15 minutes by taxi to Terminal 4.

title: (28042) Madrid - 510 Avenida Almanaque
title_short: (28042) Madrid - 510 Avenida Almanaque
description: Parking in Barajas without gauge.

title: (28730) Buitrago del Lozoya - 14A Paseo del Río Lozoya
title_short: (28730) Buitrago del Lozoya - 14A Paseo del Río Lozoya
description: Small parking for two or three motorhomes. It is a very flat, central and quiet square. Without services

title: (28739) Pinilla de Buitrago - 15 Calle Buitrago
title_short: (28739) Pinilla de Buitrago - 15 Calle Buitrago
description: There is a drinking fountain with very good outlets next to the church and there are many sinkholes nearby.

title: (28035) Madrid - 37 Calle Valle de Enmedio
title_short: (28035) Madrid - 37 Calle Valle de Enmedio
description: Free 10 minutes from the metro to go downtown with one change. Residential area.

title: (28035) Madrid - 155 Calle Valle de Enmedio
title_short: (28035) Madrid - 155 Calle Valle de Enmedio
description: Quiet, next to a police station with two subway lines nearby, fountain. Ideal for visiting the city.

title: (28042) Madrid - 112 Calle Vía Dublín
title_short: (28042) Madrid - 112 Calle Vía Dublín
description: Online parking next to IFEMA, with a subway at 200m, is between the IFEMA pavilion and a golf course. Car and truck parking place.

title: (28190) Puebla de la Sierra - M130
title_short: (28190) Puebla de la Sierra - M130
description: Large esplanade, with capacity for about 6 vans or AC. Very quiet area in the middle of nowhere next to the road with very little traffic, spectacular views of the mountains, a great place to spend the day in peace or to spend the night in the middle of nature.

title: (28046) Madrid - 2A Calle Tulipan
title_short: (28046) Madrid - 2A Calle Tulipan
description: Free gravel parking used by locals. It's a little hard to find the right entry. It seems unregulated but everybody uses it and you won't get a ticket. The entry roads are VERY bumpy with lots of potholes, it gets better inside the parking and it's worth it, you won't find a free parking as well situated in Madrid. It's very close to one of the main train stations (CHAMARTIN) and bus stations (PLAZA DE CASTILLA) and there are bars and supermarkets all around. It's also unusually silent for it's location appart from the rush hours where people parks in our out to go to work/home. I asked around and everybody said that it was a very safe place to park as well.
